SD_CrownOfKarsus.synopsis: At camp, avatar Gale ponder the Crown of Karsus after it was seen with the elder brain in the colony.

AD_Tressym.synopsis: Idle AD between Gale (Companion) and Tara while she is in camp.

Tressym.synopsis: Main dialogue for Tara, Gale's Tressym, which allows him to discover his own backstory.

SD_CrownOfKarsus_1.speaker: Narrator
SD_CrownOfKarsus_1.text: *You should get some rest, but you simply can't. Every time you close your eyes, you see the brain... and more importantly, what it possessed.*
SD_CrownOfKarsus_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale stands in a corner of the camp by himself, deep in thought (arms crossed, chin propped up in one hand)

SD_CrownOfKarsus_5.speaker: Narrator
SD_CrownOfKarsus_5.text: *An artefact. A crown. Positively reeking of Netherese magic. More than you ever felt before. More than you ever dreamed was possible.*

SD_CrownOfKarsus_4.speaker: Narrator
SD_CrownOfKarsus_4.text: *You must learn more. The book acquired from Sorcerous Sundries - it surely has the knowledge you need.*
SD_CrownOfKarsus_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale gazes off to the middistance (at nothing in particular) with a resolved expression.

SD_CrownOfKarsus_0.speaker: Narrator
SD_CrownOfKarsus_0.text: *You must learn more. There was a book in Sorcerous Sundries that surely had the knowledge you needed... but what came of it?*
SD_CrownOfKarsus_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale gazes off to the middistance (at nothing in particular) with a resolved expression.

SD_CrownOfKarsus_7.speaker: Narrator
SD_CrownOfKarsus_7.text: *Karsus himself was said to have forged such a crown, though you've never known it spoken of as anything but myth.*
SD_CrownOfKarsus_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale gazes off to the middistance (at nothing in particular) with a resolved expression.

SD_CrownOfKarsus_6.speaker: Narrator
SD_CrownOfKarsus_6.text: *The shelves at Sorcerous Sundries have been known to house the odd book on Netherese magic. It's time you made a return visit, to learn the truth about the crown, and what it could yet be capable of.*

SD_CrownOfKarsus_2.speaker: Narrator
SD_CrownOfKarsus_2.text: *The shelves at Sorcerous Sundries have been known to house the odd book on Netherese magic. It's time you paid them a visit, to learn the truth about the crown, and what it could yet be capable of.*
SD_CrownOfKarsus_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale gazes off to the middistance (at nothing in particular) with a resolved expression.

SD_CrownOfKarsus_3.speaker: Narrator
SD_CrownOfKarsus_3.text: *You should get some rest, but you simply can't. All you can think of is the brain that was beneath Moonrise Towers... and more importantly, what it was said to possess.*
SD_CrownOfKarsus_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale stands in a corner of the camp by himself, deep in thought (arms crossed, chin propped up in one hand)

AD_Tressym_0.speaker: Gale
AD_Tressym_0.text: You seem to have fared well enough without me, Tara. You look positively prosperous.

AD_Tressym_1.speaker: Gale
AD_Tressym_1.text: Or should I say, positively prosper-puss? Ha!
AD_Tressym_1.context: NodeContext: Amused by his own terrible pun.

AD_Tressym_3.speaker: Tara the Tressym
AD_Tressym_3.text: No, you should not say that ever again.

AD_Tressym_13.speaker: Tara the Tressym
AD_Tressym_13.text: True enough. That's why I came looking - to help, if I could.

AD_Tressym_9.speaker: Gale
AD_Tressym_9.text: I have not failed to notice. I truly do not deserve such loyal companionship.

AD_Tressym_10.speaker: Gale
AD_Tressym_10.text: Now I trust you won't give in to your more predatory instincts while you're here, shall you?

AD_Tressym_6.speaker: Tara the Tressym
AD_Tressym_6.text: My nature is what it is.

AD_Tressym_4.speaker: Gale
AD_Tressym_4.text: Still though - not everyone wishes for a dead bird or mouse to be laid on their bedroll as a gift.

AD_Tressym_8.speaker: Tara the Tressym
AD_Tressym_8.text: You condemn me though I did nothing. I could not find any such prize.

AD_Tressym_7.speaker: Tara the Tressym
AD_Tressym_7.text: I have done nothing wrong. Besides, surely the young owlbear would be as likely a culprit as any.

AD_Tressym_15.speaker: Tara the Tressym
AD_Tressym_15.text: This camp - is there much in the way of food?

AD_Tressym_12.speaker: Gale
AD_Tressym_12.text: No harm - unpretentious grub for intrepid adventurers. After all, you never read what heroes of yore had for their supper, do you?

AD_Tressym_14.speaker: Tara the Tressym
AD_Tressym_14.text: You and I have different tastes in books, clearly...

Tressym_11.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_11.text: There's a glint in your eye, Mr Dekarios. Explain.
Tressym_11.context: InternalNodeContext: Can only be triggered after she has returned after her pigeon-hunting.

Tressym_216.speaker: Player
Tressym_216.text: I discovered I can use the Crown of Karsus - currently atop the elder brain - to save myself.

Tressym_193.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_193.text: I imagine that's going to be somewhat difficult to retrieve. But you're quite fond of accomplishing difficult feats, aren't you?

Tressym_21.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_21.text: Like winning my unwavering affection, for instance. And oh, you did a very good job of that.

Tressym_311.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_311.text: Shoo then, Mr Dekarios. That crown isn't going to retrieve itself.

Tressym_101.speaker: Player
Tressym_101.text: There's a book I need to get from Sorcerous Sundries. To understand the crown I saw atop the elder brain.

Tressym_208.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_208.text: I never thought I'd have to convince you to prioritise a trip to a bookshop. Go on, then. Out with you!

Tressym_100.speaker: Player
Tressym_100.text: I've got hold of a book written by Karsus himself. It might be able to help me.

Tressym_172.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_172.text: Hup hup, sir! Go on and have a read - I'd very much like to know this saga had a happy ending for my favourite fellow.

Tressym_94.speaker: Player
Tressym_94.text: We had our hands on a book written by Karsus himself. It might've been able to help me.

Tressym_14.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_14.text: I can't fathom why you're speaking in the past tense, sir. If you've lost the damn thing, I expect you to get busy finding it. It could be the key to your salvation.

Tressym_57.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_57.text: If I have to go search for it myself, I'm going to take it out on the legs of your leather chaise.

Tressym_75.speaker: Player
Tressym_75.text: Back in Moonrise Towers I saw an elder brain, wearing a curious Netherese crown. I need to find out more about it...

Tressym_46.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_46.text: Well! We are in Baldur's Gate, aren't we? You've always been very positive about the selection of books in Sorcerous Sundries. An opportunity for research, perhaps.

Tressym_38.speaker: Player
Tressym_38.text: Good point - I'll have another visit.

Tressym_273.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_273.text: Search carefully, sir. The good things are usually either behind glass, or buried under a stack of loathsome picture papers.

Tressym_220.speaker: Player
Tressym_220.text: Waterdeep has ten better bookshops on any given street.

Tressym_244.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_244.text: And if you can't find what you're looking for in Sorcerous Sundries, I'll go check them all. But for now - get on with it!

Tressym_148.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_148.text: Boyish charm and knees that creak like rusted hinges! Quite the combination.

Tressym_18.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_18.text: What's that? For a moment I thought my friend Mr Dekarios was near, but now I see it's only the ghost of one of Mystra's playthings.
Tressym_18.context: NodeContext: Tara is angry at Gale, masking her hurt that he might die.

Tressym_45.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_45.text: Well, if it isn't my favourite fellow himself.
Tressym_45.context: InternalNodeContext: Greeting in the camp, before meeting Elminster.

Tressym_183.speaker: Player
Tressym_183.text: How are things back in Waterdeep?

Tressym_248.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_248.text: More or less the same - though news of some mad faction calling themselves 'Absolutists' is starting to trickle in.

Tressym_282.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_282.text: I told your mother not to worry. That if they were anything to worry about, Baldur's Gate would handle things quick-sharp. Keep them from spreading their tendrils north.

Tressym_3.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_3.text: She still wants to know when she'll see you again, sir. I avoid giving any answers. But she misses you.

Tressym_238.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_238.text: I'll tell her. With my catflap of displacement, I can afford the occasional visit. I'd bring you along, if I could. Perhaps some day.

Tressym_307.speaker: Player
Tressym_307.text: I can't risk putting her in danger.

Tressym_89.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_89.text: I know that, but she doesn't. She'd keel over if she knew just how you'd tried to manipulate the Weave.

Tressym_263.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_263.text: Or maybe she'd just say something like, 'My Gale always was one to make the impossible possible.' Oh, but she adores you.
Tressym_263.context: NodeContext: With affection. Tara loves Gale's mom.

Tressym_67.speaker: Player
Tressym_67.text: No more guilt trips, Tara. Please.

Tressym_166.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_166.text: But then whatever will we talk about?

Tressym_242.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_242.text: Anyhow - I'm keeping my senses pricked for any sign of another item that might be of use to you. Hopefully something will turn up soon.

Tressym_230.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_230.text: You focus on that parasite. I daresay turning into a mind flayer may set that bomb off as quick as anything. No time to waste.

Tressym_192.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_192.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale bends down and scritches TAra behind the ears and/or above the tail. She loves it. Purring sound effects.

Tressym_286.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_286.text: Chin up and keep at it, sir. And don't forget to pet your favourite tressym for good luck.

Tressym_59.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_59.text: This disobedience of yours had best continue once you find this Heart of the Absolute, Gale. That's all I have to say to you.
Tressym_59.context: NodeContext: Tara is angry at Gale, masking her hurt that he might die.

Tressym_60.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_60.text: Ah! Oh, goodness. That thing on your face is even worse than I remember.
Tressym_60.context: InternalNodeContext: Greeting in the camp, before meeting Elminster.NodeContext: A shout of surprise. Talking about Gale's beard, which she detests

Tressym_68.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_68.text: Mr Dekarios, if you have to ask, there's no hope for you at all.

Tressym_268.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_268.text: Please tell me you've at least made inroads when it comes to finding someone to settle down with. Myself and Mrs Dekarios are starting to think you intend to die alone.

Tressym_160.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_160.text: Naturally. After you abandoned her, there was only me left to keep her company.

Tressym_280.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_280.text: She's very good company, though. Ah, the stories we've traded over toast and tea. You're a highly entertaining source of speculation.

Tressym_332.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_332.text: But speculation only goes so far! Tell me, Mr Dekarios - how have you been?

Tressym_76.speaker: Player
Tressym_76.text: I've been a bit preoccupied, you know.

Tressym_186.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_186.text: Doing what, exactly? Last I checked, that orb is still pulsating inside you, vulgar as ever.

Tressym_8.speaker: Player
Tressym_8.text: To be honest, it's been nothing but one escalating problem after the other.

Tressym_312.speaker: Player
Tressym_312.text: I was abducted on a nautiloid and infected with an illithid parasite.

Tressym_74.speaker: Player
Tressym_74.text: I've mostly been looking for artefacts to help stabilise me. It's a full-time job.

Tressym_190.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_190.text: Indeed. It took me a good long while to find just the one - and an even longer while figuring out how to transport it here.

Tressym_119.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_119.text: So - what's your plan? Why this region? What in particular are you looking for?

Tressym_296.speaker: Player
Tressym_296.text: The truth is a bit shocking. I was kidnapped by mind flayers, infected with a parasite, and left here after their ship crashed. Now I'm looking for a cure.

Tressym_239.speaker: Player
Tressym_239.text: Long enough to find a cure, I hope.

Tressym_39.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_39.text: Mr Dekarios. Gale. You are the finest mind - the finest wizard - I have ever had the pleasure to know.

Tressym_299.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_299.text: If anyone can beat this thing, it is you.

Tressym_95.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_95.text: When you tried to control the Weave - when it all went, pardon my language, belly up - I was terrified.

Tressym_194.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_194.text: Scared you'd be hurt. Scared Mystra would punish you for your transgression. But do you know what never crossed my mind?

Tressym_72.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_72.text: That you wouldn't figure a way out of it. My clever friend never leaves a knot knotted. This parasite is one more knot, so get to tugging threads.

Tressym_58.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_58.text: And - Mr Dekarios - please. The beard. I'd cut it down myself if I could hold a razor.

Tressym_27.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_27.text: Well. I won't lie, this is a terrible problem. But do you know who's a dab hand at solving terrible problems? Brilliant wizards.

Tressym_180.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_180.text: Ah-ah. I will not be dismissed! Tell me, Gale. What's going on?

Tressym_77.speaker: Player
Tressym_77.text: If you must know, there is someone...

Tressym_336.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_336.text: Rrriaow! AHEM! That is, you must tell me every detail, Mr Dekarios.
Tressym_336.context: NodeContext: Tara meows in excitement and anticiaption after hearing juicy gossip, and then startles, embarrassed that she let her feline instincts get the better of her.

Tressym_302.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_302.text: About many things, actually. You left the tower in such a hurry, and you didn't leave an address.

Tressym_171.speaker: Player
Tressym_171.text: If you think that's bad, just wait 'til you find out what's in my head.

Tressym_255.speaker: Player
Tressym_255.text: Surely we have more important things to discuss, Tara.

Tressym_79.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_79.text: Well, sir? How goes the search?

Tressym_86.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_86.text: I know that look. Come on - out with it. What's happened?
Tressym_86.context: InternalNodeContext: Gale spoke to Elminster 2 in LOW and received the instruction to come speak with Mystra

Tressym_179.speaker: Player
Tressym_179.text: I bumped into Elminster. I say 'bumped into' - he was waiting for me outside Sorcerous Sundries.

Tressym_29.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_29.text: Elminster? And what did he have to say for himself?

Tressym_34.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_34.text: I hope he apologised for that horrid message he brought the last time he graced us with his presence.

Tressym_201.speaker: Player
Tressym_201.text: He came with a message from Mystra. She wants to speak with me.

Tressym_122.speaker: Player
Tressym_122.text: No such luck. He came to summon me on Mystra's behalf. Though I'm not sure it's a summons I want to obey.

Tressym_161.speaker: Player
Tressym_161.text: Something like that. Don't worry - it's nothing I can't handle.

Tressym_309.speaker: Player
Tressym_309.text: I found the book I needed in Sorcerous Sundries. And I'm fairly positive Mystra knows about it.

Tressym_102.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_102.text: There's not much escapes her sights, that's for certain. But she can hardly have told you this herself. Why so sure?

Tressym_328.speaker: Player
Tressym_328.text: I bumped into Elminster. I say 'bumped into' - he was waiting for me outside Sorcerous Sundries.

Tressym_283.speaker: Player
Tressym_283.text: Just a gut feeling, I suppose. Nothing I can't handle.

Tressym_235.speaker: Player
Tressym_235.text: A successful shopping trip, that's all.

Tressym_33.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_33.text: That's not the look you have when you've been on a spending spree, Mr Dekarios. You look... guilty.

Tressym_251.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_251.text: If something's happened that I should know about, I'd rather you were honest with me. We are in this together, aren't we?

Tressym_287.speaker: Player
Tressym_287.text: Don't worry. It's nothing I can't hande.

Tressym_92.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_92.text: Ah. Mr Dekarios. You seem... different. Better. What's the meaning of this?

Tressym_224.speaker: Player
Tressym_224.text: I met our good friend Elminster. He stabilised the orb for me.

Tressym_196.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_196.text: About time that old book-a-bones showed his face! I've been looking for him - for precisely the reason you outline.

Tressym_232.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_232.text: No more pricey artefacts for you then, is that it? Excellent. You were quickly becoming the most expensive pet in the Realms.
Tressym_232.context: NodeContext: With a wink, she's being cheeky

Tressym_300.speaker: Player
Tressym_300.text: There's more to it than that, I'm afraid.

Tressym_48.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_48.text: Oh? Well, do go on, Mr Dekarios.
Tressym_48.context: NodeContext: Realizes something is amiss. Starts to get a little worried.

Tressym_55.speaker: Player
Tressym_55.text: Elminster also brought instructions from Mystra. I'm to detonate the orb once I find the 'Heart of the Absolute.'

Tressym_32.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_32.text: My gods! She didn't. She wouldn't!
Tressym_32.context: NodeContext: Tara aghast. Gale told her about Mystra' plan

Tressym_6.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_6.text: Mystra is a god. She can handle this without taking your life in the bargain, surely!
Tressym_6.context: NodeContext: Tara aghast. Gale told her about Mystra' plan

Tressym_98.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_98.text: Tell me you aren't going to go through with it!
Tressym_98.context: NodeContext: Tara aghast. Gale told her about Mystra' plan

Tressym_167.speaker: Player
Tressym_167.text: The Absolute has to be stopped. I'm no great loss in the bargain.

Tressym_217.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_217.text: You are to me. Or doesn't my opinion matter?
Tressym_217.context: NodeContext: She's dead sincere, but she's also a bit manipulative here.

Tressym_206.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_206.text: Surely there's another way. Use your head, Mr Dekarios. It's what you do best.

Tressym_326.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_326.text: Promise me, Gale. Promise me you'll find another way. Promise me you'll return home, when this is all over.

Tressym_205.speaker: Player
Tressym_205.text: I can't make that promise, Tara.

Tressym_197.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_197.text: You're going to kill me. And your mother. And then there'll be no one to mourn you when you've wasted yourself for no good reason at all.

Tressym_81.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_81.text: Damn the Absolute. Damn Mystra. Damn it all, if you go through with this, Gale.

Tressym_17.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_17.text: Go! I don't want to look at you anymore! Go on!
Tressym_17.context: NodeContext: Feigning anger but actually she's heartbroken because Gale has said he's going to explode himself if needed.

Tressym_291.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_291.text: Ghastly boy. But fine. I'll take what I'm given and be grateful for it.
Tressym_291.context: NodeContext: Frustrated with Gale but can't force him to be more firm.

Tressym_131.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_131.text: Now go on. We don't want to make a scene, do we? There's a good lad.
Tressym_131.context: NodeContext: Avoiding crying, shutting down the convo before it goes too far.

Tressym_324.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_324.text: Thank heavens! I thought I was going to have to claw some sense into you.

Tressym_31.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_31.text: You are too precious to meet your end splattered all over an illithid monstrosity. No no. I won't allow it.

Tressym_99.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_99.text: I'm glad you aren't considering such a ridiculous proposition. You've a good head on your shoulders, Mr Dekarios. No matter what anyone says.

Tressym_150.speaker: Player
Tressym_150.text: I owe Mystra this. If I have a chance to earn her forgiveness, I have to take it.

Tressym_170.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_170.text: Mystra is a god, Gale. We pay her her due, but not with our lives. Your duty isn't to Mystra. Your duty is to return to Waterdeep. To continue your research, to live your life!

Tressym_12.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_12.text: She really wants to kill you, Gale? To squander your life? Is that really a god you want to serve?

Tressym_225.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_225.text: Gods! At this rate I'll have to give up the Weave and take up a crossbow. Get the gods out of our business entirely.

Tressym_26.speaker: Player
Tressym_26.text: I'm still considering all my options.

Tressym_331.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_331.text: Consider this, Gale Dekarios: I forbid you to undertake this fool's errand.

Tressym_25.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_25.text: It isn't your job to do the gods' dirty work for them. If Mystra wants to intervene, let her do so at her own peril.

Tressym_65.speaker: Player
Tressym_65.text: No. I'm determined to find another way.

Tressym_212.speaker: Player
Tressym_212.text: I'm afraid you won't like it very much...

Tressym_231.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_231.text: Don't let that stop you. There's a great deal I don't like, but I haven't keeled over yet.

Tressym_109.speaker: Player
Tressym_109.text: You should return to Waterdeep now, Tara. It isn't safe here.

Tressym_292.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_292.text: I can look after myself. And you, while I'm at it. But what's wrong, Gale? There's something on your mind. Out with it.

Tressym_80.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_80.text: I'm not one to pry. I'd rather make up all the juicy details myself over tea with your mother.

Tressym_204.speaker: Player
Tressym_204.text: Who are you calling a pet?

Tressym_84.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_84.text: You are my pet. And I'm yours. A perfect circle of companionship. I don't know about you, but I wouldn't have it any other way.

Tressym_303.speaker: Player
Tressym_303.text: Tell me, Tara. What have you been up to in my absence?

Tressym_222.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_222.text: A-slinking and a-stalking, of course. This is a fascinating area of the Realms - this cult of the Absolute is taking over like a bad rash.

Tressym_85.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_85.text: That parasite in your head seems to be quiet enough, thank the gods.

Tressym_337.speaker: Player
Tressym_337.text: Yes. Pleased to say I remain intact, with no signs of ceremorphosis or spontaneous combustion on the horizon.

Tressym_162.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_162.text: Attaboy! Keep doing what you're doing, then. We'll have this whole business sorted in no time.

Tressym_2.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_2.text: I'll be sure to let your mother know you'll be home before she knows it - for a nice long visit.

Tressym_13.speaker: Player
Tressym_13.text: I don't know, Tara, I'm feeling a little... tentacular.

Tressym_182.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_182.text: Away with you, then! I have no desire to bear witness to such a distasteful process.

Tressym_106.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_106.text: But if you've still a warm lap on you when all's said and done, we can still be friends. I suppose.

Tressym_147.speaker: Player
Tressym_147.text: Will you still love me when I'm a mind flayer?

Tressym_237.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_237.text: Depends. Are mind flayers warm-blooded? If so, my prize napping spot on your lap won't be compromised. In which case, I suppose we could find an accord.

Tressym_320.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_320.text: And, of course, your mother would still think you a prince, no matter how many tentacles you had. And with a nautiloid, you may even manage to visit her more often.

Tressym_137.speaker: Player
Tressym_137.text: Do I need a reason to be looking well, Tara?

Tressym_61.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_61.text: You've a Netherese orb in your belly, a tadpole in your head, and you've been sleeping in what amounts to a very well-appointed ditch. So go on - explain yourself.

Tressym_69.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_69.text: Don't be silly. What is it really?

Tressym_93.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_93.context: InternalNodeContext: Greeting node from end of act 2 onwards, if there's nothing else to discuss.NodeContext: Very warm and affectionate.

Tressym_143.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_143.text: Unless you've got Mr Dek- erm, Gale in your pocket, I don't believe we have terribly much to say to one another.
Tressym_143.context: NodeContext: Stumbling because she doesn't usually call him by his first name.

Tressym_149.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_149.text: Mr Dekarios, sir! Why - you're back!

Tressym_211.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_211.text: I was... I was quite terrified you wouldn't return. What happened in there?

Tressym_111.speaker: Player
Tressym_111.text: I defied Mystra's orders. She's lost to me forever.

Tressym_154.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_154.text: You've got that quite the wrong way around, Mr Dekarios. She has lost you, and is a poorer goddess for it.

Tressym_97.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_97.text: So? What led to this decision?

Tressym_335.speaker: Player
Tressym_335.text: I found the Heart of the Absolute. It was an elder brain, wearing a strange Netherese crown...

Tressym_169.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_169.text: We are heading to Baldur's Gate, aren't we? You've always been very positive about the selection of books in Sorcerous Sundries. An opportunity for research, perhaps.

Tressym_288.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_288.text: You get all your best ideas from books, don't you, sir? Your worst ones, too... but it's worth the risk.

Tressym_247.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_247.text: For now, I'm terribly glad you're all right. If I'd lost you to a giant brain, the irony would have been intolerable.

Tressym_70.speaker: Player
Tressym_70.text: I faced the Chosen of Myrkul and got a glimpse of where this journey will lead us.

Tressym_36.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_36.text: I won't ask for more details. All I know is we can lick this thing. Rough-tongued and ready.

Tressym_310.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_310.text: We're heading to Baldur's Gate, aren't we? You've always been very positive about the selection of books in Sorcerous Sundries. An opportunity for research, perhaps.

Tressym_136.speaker: Player
Tressym_136.text: I'd rather not talk about it.

Tressym_105.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_105.text: That's quite all right, sir. Quiet company is more my specialty, anyway.

Tressym_188.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_188.text: I'll be gone with the morning light, sir. Though one last fuss wouldn't go amiss before then.

Tressym_240.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_240.text: You will find a better solution to this whole 'Absolute' business, won't you? I'm always bragging about your ingenuity and I'd hate to be thought a liar.
Tressym_240.context: NodeContext: Strict, masking her concern - Gale's shown signs he won't blow himself up, so she's less mad at him

Tressym_250.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_250.text: Come now, don't keep me in suspense. How was your reunion with the Mother of All Magic?
Tressym_250.context: InternalNodeContext: Gale spoke with Mystra at the Stormshore Tabernacle, Tara knew of this quest.NodeContext: slightly wry

Tressym_200.speaker: Player
Tressym_200.text: It went about as well as I expected.

Tressym_127.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_127.text: I'm going to need more details, sir.

Tressym_152.speaker: Player
Tressym_152.text: Excruciatingly awkward. On my side, at least.

Tressym_42.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_42.text: Don't be too hard on yourself, sir. You've been like that all your life.

Tressym_142.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_142.text: Why did she summon you? And how worried do I need to be about what she's asked of you this time?

Tressym_265.speaker: Player
Tressym_265.text: She wants me to bring the Crown of Karsus to her when the elder brain is defeated. She said she can cure the orb.

Tressym_158.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_158.text: Oh! Well! That's a better report than I feared.

Tressym_246.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_246.text: Oh, I always knew Mystra had a good heart. Deep, deep down.

Tressym_297.speaker: Player
Tressym_297.text: She wants me to bring the Crown of Karsus to her when the elder brain is defeated.

Tressym_187.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_187.text: Finally a task worth completing. Do her this little favour, and she'll have no excuse not to cure that wretched orb of yours.

Tressym_314.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_314.text: You'll do what she says, won't you?

Tressym_114.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_114.text: There's a fireplace and a half-read book waiting for us in Waterdeep. It's about time we went home.

Tressym_16.speaker: Player
Tressym_16.text: She told me the orb is actually the Karsite Weave. I think there's a chance I could control it, if I reforge the Crown.

Tressym_229.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_229.text: Control the orb? Control the brain?

Tressym_254.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_254.text: Karsus' powers should have perished with him. You cannot trust such powers. You know better than this, don't you?

Tressym_262.speaker: Player
Tressym_262.text: I'd never want to lose you, Tara. I'll return the Crown to Mystra.

Tressym_285.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_285.text: There's a good humanoid. You had me scared for a moment here.

Tressym_90.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_90.text: But you're wise - and wiser all the time. Do what Mystra asks, and I'm positive she will cure you of that wretched orb.

Tressym_195.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_195.text: You're almost at the end of this, Gale. You're nearly there.

Tressym_221.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_221.text: And not a moment too soon. Myself, I must away to Waterdeep. Your mother will be worried silly not to have heard from either of us - and now I can bring her the good news.

Tressym_56.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_56.text: When this is all over I'll be waiting for you, with a crackling fire and good book at the ready. Good luck, darling.

Tressym_133.speaker: Player
Tressym_133.text: I've no need of your approval, Tara. I don't need a cat that badly.

Tressym_134.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_134.text: If you're that immature, you're not ready for one tenth of Karsus' powers. And I'll play no part in helping you get them.

Tressym_37.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_37.text: Goodbye, Mr Dekarios. Try to regrow the bits of your brain that parasite has obviously been eating. Before it's too late.

Tressym_322.speaker: Player
Tressym_322.text: I'll consider what you've said. But I'm not making any promises.

Tressym_54.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_54.text: I thought you'd have learned by now what pursuing such power can cost. If you haven't... well, I'm not sure who's left to teach it to you.

Tressym_121.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_121.text: You've got a chance at salvation in front of you. Don't be a fool. Take it.

Tressym_209.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_209.text: You must choose, Gale. And you'll have to do it alone, I'm afraid.

Tressym_159.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_159.text: I'm well past due to return to Waterdeep. I'm going to tell your mother that you'll be home soon. Don't make a liar of me, darling.

Tressym_295.speaker: Player
Tressym_295.text: She told me the orb is actually the Karsite Weave. When I seize the Crown of Karsus, I'll be able to control it at last. I'll be a god.

Tressym_281.speaker: Player
Tressym_281.text: She offered me a path to forgiveness. One I have a far better chance of surviving.

Tressym_279.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_279.text: That sounds like a path well worth the walking! And I shall trot along right beside you. Or flutter. It really depends on the terrain.

Tressym_132.speaker: Player
Tressym_132.text: I didn't stay long enough to find out.
Tressym_132.context: InternalNodeContext: If Gale didn't make it far enough in the conversation to learn the quest - e.g. died due to status effect

Tressym_64.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_64.text: Oh. That's no fun. I was hoping for a good bit of gossip.

Tressym_315.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_315.text: I'll have to make up some good news for your dear mother, then. I'm going home, Gale. To look after Mrs Dekarios, and to remind you that there are people waiting for you in Waterdeep.

Tressym_261.speaker: Player
Tressym_261.text: She just wanted to clear the air between us.

Tressym_141.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_141.text: If that's all, then what comes after is for you to decide, Mr Dekarios. Think well on all that's happened, and stay true to that heart of yours. It's a good one.

Tressym_15.speaker: Player
Tressym_15.text: Let's just say, I'm glad it's over with.

Tressym_257.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_257.text: What is it, Mr Dekarios? You look like you've seen a ghost.
Tressym_257.context: InternalNodeContext: Gale spoke with Mystra at the Stormshore Tabernacle, Tara knew of this quest.

Tressym_0.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_0.text: Did you now? About time she showed her... erm, does she have a face?
Tressym_0.context: NodeContext: Almost to herself, she really doesn't know

Tressym_129.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_129.text: Well, out with it then. How did it go?

Tressym_23.speaker: Player
Tressym_23.text: I have. The ghost of love past.

Tressym_30.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_30.text: Hmm. I smell the outer planes on you. Mystra, then, is it?

Tressym_156.speaker: Player
Tressym_156.text: It's very unsettling how you can tell what I've been up to just by looking at me...

Tressym_325.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_325.text: Tressyms are exceptionally intuitive. And also, you wear your emotions like a very garish cravat.

Tressym_260.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_260.text: Not another word out of you 'til you've consumed that artefact, Mr Dekarios.
Tressym_260.context: InternalNodeContext: Should be mad exclusive and flag checked false once the GotOneMagicItem flag is set on eating the item.

Tressym_289.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_289.text: Do hurry up and speak with Mystra, won't you? Curiosity might kill cats, but I assure you tardiness torments the tressym.

Tressym_305.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_305.text: What's that? For a moment I thought my friend Mr Dekarios was near, but now I see it's only the ghost of one of Mystra's playthings.
Tressym_305.context: NodeContext: Tara is angry at Gale, masking her hurt that he might die.

Tressym_316.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_316.text: Oh, thank the heavens! The barbarous beard has been slain at last!
Tressym_316.context: InternalNodeContext: Greeting in the camp, before meeting Elminster.NodeContext: A shout of surprise. Talking about Gale's beard, which she detests

Tressym_319.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_319.text: Much as I enjoy our little chats, Mr Dekarios, I think it's Elminster you must speak to.
Tressym_319.context: InternalNodeContext: Elminster 2 is currently in camp and needs to talk to Gale urgently

Tressym_215.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_215.text: Do go find out the gossip, won't you?

Tressym_327.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_327.text: Shoo, now! Off to see Elminster with you.

Tressym_338.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_338.text: So, what did Elminster have to say that he couldn't possibly have told me, your closest companion and confidante?
Tressym_338.context: InternalNodeContext: Gale spoke to Elminster 2 in camp and was given Mystra's instruction to come speak with her

Tressym_306.speaker: Player
Tressym_306.text: Nothing to concern yourself with. Just passing on an invitation from an old friend.

Tressym_144.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_144.text: I'm your only old friend, Mr Dekarios. We both know that much.
Tressym_144.context: InternalNodeContext: Gale received instruction from Elminster to go meet with Mystra at the Stormshore Tabernacle

Tressym_176.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_176.text: So. What did Elminster have to say for himself?

Tressym_123.speaker: Player
Tressym_123.text: I've been summoned by Mystra. She's willing to speak to me.

Tressym_334.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_334.text: And are you willing to speak with her?

Tressym_269.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_269.text: Well then. No sense delaying a conversation like that. Who knows when she'll next demand you blow yourself up, after all?

Tressym_219.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_219.text: You will tell me what she says, won't you? Of course you will.

Tressym_267.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_267.text: Now Mr Dekarios - you know I'm as cynical about Mystra's recent behaviour as the next tressym, but if she's reached out to you like this, it must be important.

Tressym_140.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_140.text: Hear what she has to say. At the very least you'll be better armed to survive what comes next. And that's the most important thing.

Tressym_202.speaker: Player
Tressym_202.text: Mystra wants to see me, though I'm not sure I want to see her.

Tressym_274.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_274.text: And why would you, after what she's asked of you?

Tressym_258.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_258.text: Then again... perhaps she's got something useful to say, for once.

Tressym_293.speaker: Player
Tressym_293.text: You're right. I should hear her out.

Tressym_125.speaker: Player
Tressym_125.text: If she has, she could have offered it long before now.

Tressym_275.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_275.text: Well, you know the gods. When they indulge in a bit of divine intervention, they do so like to pick their moments. Us mere mortals have no choice but to go along for the ride.

Tressym_103.speaker: Player
Tressym_103.text: I don't care if she does. She's not my goddess any longer.

Tressym_203.speaker: Player
Tressym_203.text: I'm honestly not sure. But don't worry - it's nothing I can't handle.

Tressym_66.speaker: Tara the Tressym
Tressym_66.text: I suppose I'll leave it be, so long as this thing you're 'handling' won't blow us all to smithereens.
